faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about TaskScribe

internet.q: Do I need internet to use TaskScribe?
internet.a: No! TaskScribe works 100% offline. Transcription is done locally on your computer. You only need internet to download the app initially and, optionally, to use AI features like task extraction with OpenAI or Gemini.

requirements.a: Windows 10+, macOS 11+ or Linux (Ubuntu, Fedora, Debian). We recommend 8GB of RAM and 5GB of disk space. NVIDIA GPU with CUDA is optional but greatly accelerates processing.

pricing.a: We have a free plan with 5 free transcriptions per month. The Pro plan costs $19/month (or $190/year with 17% discount) and offers unlimited transcriptions + AI features for task extraction.

storage.a: All data is saved only on your computer, in the app's local folder. Nothing is sent to external servers. You have full control over your files.

formats.q: What audio and video formats are supported?
formats.a: We import: MP4, MKV, MOV, AVI, WebM, MP3, WAV, M4A, AAC, FLAC and more. We export transcriptions in: TXT, Markdown (MD), JSON and SRT (subtitles).

languages.a: Whisper supports over 99 languages including Portuguese, English, Spanish, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Chinese, Korean and many others. The interface is available in PT-BR and EN-US.

diarization.a: It's the ability to recognize and separate who is speaking in a recording with multiple people. TaskScribe automatically identifies different voices and marks each speech as SPEAKER_00, SPEAKER_01, etc. You can rename them later.

gpu.q: Do I need a GPU to use it?
gpu.a: Not mandatory! TaskScribe works with CPU too, but will be slower. If you have an NVIDIA GPU with CUDA, processing can be up to 4x faster.
